Post.title: My first English diary
Post._content:
Hi.
This is my first English log. 
Now, Iâ€™m learning English every day, But my English level is poor. 
If I want to go abroad,I must to learn more English and improve my English level. 
Iâ€™m have been learning English for a year,but My English so bad yet, because I never spend more time to learn it,Iâ€™ve been spend more to play these video games on my Switch. 
Now,I donâ€™t have more time,I only have four months to prepare my IELTS. 
Come!Do it!Donâ€™t waste my time to play game!If I get a nice IELTS,I can spend even more time to play these games!
This is a nice start, Iâ€™ll record my process of learning for English at here. 
Go get it!I trust me,I can do it!

Post.title: Action is Better than Preparedness
Post._content:
The quote from The "Doctrine Of The Mean" goes,"In all thingsï¼Œsuccess lies in previous preparations and there will be failure without previous preparations",But in some senseï¼Œexcessive preparation becames a manifestation of procrastination.
For instance,when I need to improve my writing level,maybe I'll think I need a pretty pen,a beautiful notebook and a comfortable chair.However 
The procrastinator usually can't understand a truth:Thorough preparation aims to make things perfect,while endless procrastination prevents one from taking the first step towards getting started.
For example,a good pair of running shoes can improve the running experience;a pair of HiFi headphones can make music more enjoyable.However,the essence of running lies in the act of running itself,and the essence of music lies in the music itself.As we enter the state of"being in progress",the importance of those so-called "preparations" gradually fades away.
If we consider something as an "exam",then"thorough preparation" is merely an "extra score",and the real key to "passing" lies in "taking action".
Only through action can we truly experience the joy of the process and the achievements of the resultsï¼Œand only then can we achieve real growth and progress.

Post.more:
The quote from The â€œDoctrine Of The Meanâ€ goes,â€In all thingsï¼Œsuccess lies in previous preparations and there will be failure without previous preparationsâ€,But in some senseï¼Œexcessive preparation becames a manifestation of procrastination.
For instance,when I need to improve my writing level,maybe Iâ€™ll think I need a pretty pen,a beautiful notebook and a comfortable chair.However
The procrastinator usually canâ€™t understand a truth:Thorough preparation aims to make things perfect,while endless procrastination prevents one from taking the first step towards getting started.
For example,a good pair of running shoes can improve the running experience;a pair of HiFi headphones can make music more enjoyable.However,the essence of running lies in the act of running itself,and the essence of music lies in the music itself.As we enter the state ofâ€being in progressâ€,the importance of those so-called â€œpreparationsâ€ gradually fades away.
If we consider something as an â€œexamâ€,thenâ€thorough preparationâ€ is merely an â€œextra scoreâ€,and the real key to â€œpassingâ€ lies in â€œtaking actionâ€.
Only through action can we truly experience the joy of the process and the achievements of the resultsï¼Œand only then can we achieve real growth and progress.

Post.title: How to maintain good energy
Post._content:
My sleeping time always is less than eight hours. For example, today I only had six hours of sleep. Last night, I went to bed at 1 a.m., and then I woke up at 7 a.m.
If I want to do anything, I must have a clear mind, but I always donâ€™t have it.
When Iâ€™m learning something, if I'm tired, I can't finish it very well. So, good sleep is very valuable.

How to maintain good sleep?

First, don't go to bed too late. When Iâ€™m using my cellphone, I usually forget about the time. Sometimes, I get excited while using some apps and I can't stop using them because they always bring too much fun to me. It feels like a bad person stealing your focus and then selling it for just a little money.

Second, take a quick break whenever you feel tired, have a short nap, and set an alarm clock for about fifteen minutes. A short nap will help you maintain nice energy for about two hours. It's very cost-effective.

Third, it is the most important thing, don't eat too much food! Our stomach is like a machine. When it is in operation, it will concentrate a mass of blood, and our brain's efficiency will decrease. Especially when we eat meat or grain, we will feel sleepy. But when weâ€™re hungry, the phenomenon of sleepiness will be less. 

Great work requires nice energy. Establish good habits, and then we can get twice the result with half the effort.
